DOC.brief_title: Total Ankle Replacement Versus Arthrodesis Trial
DOC.detailed_description: This randomise , multi-centre , non-blinded , prospective , parallel-group trial TAR versus ankle arthrodesis patient end-stage ankle osteoarthritis ( OA ) age 50 85 year , compare clinical outcome ( pain-free function , quality life ( QoL ) , range motion ( ROM ) , rate post-procedural complication ) cost-effectiveness . TARVA clinician-led , pragmatic , superiority trial design compare improvement pain-free function , assess Manchester-Oxford Foot Questionnaire ( MOXFQ ) walking/standing domain score pre-op 52 week post-op surgical treatment group . A total 328 patient randomly allocate equal basis one two surgical treatment : ) Total Ankle Replacement ; ii ) Ankle Arthrodesis . Randomisation stratify surgeon presence OA two adjacent joint determine pre-operative MRI scan .
